name: Formby Hall Golf Resort & Spa

reviews.text: I have just returned from a very disappointing stay at Formby Hall - it could have been good but there is no communication between staff at this hotel and they appear to have no guest relations team whatsover, so what should have been a special occassion for a close friend turned into a disasterous (almost comical) spa break.
reviews.title: A very disappointing stay - will not return

reviews.text: I found the hotel on the Spaseekers website when looking for incentives to buy female staff and spent a not inconsiderable amount of money with the hotel spa buying spa days for my staff.
reviews.title: FABULOUS SPA DAY

reviews.text: After reading the reviews I decided to take a very glamorous and youthful friend for a night of top to toe pampering for her 60th birthday. Two other girlfriends decided to join us so I booked two executive rooms for one night DBB, three top of the range spa days and further beauty treatments.
reviews.title: what a fabulous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I made the reservations I informed the hotel, over the phone and in email that it was my friends 60th and requested we had rooms either next door or close to each other.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: The day before one of the girls dropped out due to illness so I changed the booking, again by phone and confirmed in an email, from two twins to one double and one twin. I again requested the rooms be together and stated it was my friends 60th and she would be in the double on her own.
reviews.title: formby hall equestrian centre looks really nice just what were looking for

reviews.text: Christmas meal and entertainment booked at Formby Hall, Christmas 2010. Snow arrived evening before our 'do' and all roads impassable, glad rags ready but couldn't get there. New Year dawns contact Formby Hall hoping goodwill prevailing to be told that we as a party of 40 - 50 at £40 per head had lost our money as they were open but we didn't get there. After much haggling they agreed to an alternate Spring 'belated celebration'. Fair play we thought, all looked forward to our belated Christmas get together.
reviews.title: Belated Christmas Meal Misery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Menus arrived which were very limited in choice, but we maintained the enthusiasm. Arrived for meal - were told there would be some entertainment - a background singer whilst we ate our meal, very low key, very not celebaratory. Meal arrived, nicely presented but a distinct lack of vegetables, by time vegetable dish arrived between myself and colleague we had to split 2 very sad greeen beans and a slice of parsnip/carrot couldn't distinguish what it was. My colleague spoke to the waiter and asked for another dish of vegetables as wasn't enough provided for those of us who had ordered cod - message came back 'the chef said no'. Asked 4 times for a jug of iced water - not instead or alcoholic beverages just to enjoy with, glasses of water were eventually provided but jug was not forthcoming - we were eventually told that all the jugs had been used at the wedding receptions and none were available. Tables were not cleared at end of meal.
reviews.title: Definatly not 4* IT SHOULD BE 5*!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finished our meal and entertainment had long since finished.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Meal was overpriced, it was worth half of what I paid. A big group of people looking to book their next Christmas night out - it will definitely not be at Formby Hall - they want your money but once they have it customer satisfaction goes out of the window.
reviews.title: Our Wedding , just amazing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 1 night and spent 1 full day in the spa with my partner.
reviews.title: Will definitely go back.......
Enjoyable Stay.
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel March 2011, To use as a base for visiting family,The receptionist on arrival (Leanne )was very friendly and excellent providing information regarding the hotels facilities and location of our room. The hotel and Spa is worthy of its star rating, Our room was clean and spacious,Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice to choose from. Had dinner in the restaurant at £15.00 a head for two courses,and had a lovely meal for such good value.When I made my original booking it was for 2 nights,but it was so relaxing I payed for an extra night. I will use this hotel always when visiting family.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel, shame about the golf course management
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for stay and 2 days of golf. We were warmly greeted at the reception desk. I asked for a room with a view of the golf course but they can only do this by getting an upgrade at a cost of £15 extra. I thought it will be worth it. After finishing our first round of golf we picked up the key from the reception. What a big disappointment because the room was like a box room in the corner of the building looking out mostly to one side of the building and with just a glimpse of the golf course. The one tiny window I could only see out if I stand on a stool. I am 5'2. I just couldn't stay a night in this room, Instantly I felt very claustrophobic. And so we complained to the reception. She's a lovely girl, she changed our room to, take note: Room 201. Whooaaa.....what a room!!!! with a view to the whole golf course just few yards to the 18th and 9th greens and just below the balcony is the putting practice green. The room has king sized bed (2 singles put together), the bath and shower room spotless with some toiletries, there's a fridge with free bottled water (very thoughtful), a little box of chocolates (nice touch), modern flat screen television, iron and ironing board, safe, hairdryer etc. We found that there was only one robe and pair of slippers in the room so we rang the reception again. No problem. 5 minutes later another robe and pair of slippers was sent to our room. After admiring the views around and just settling in I searched all over the room to find the television remote control so I can check the following day's weather forecast. The previous guest must have packed away the tv remote by accident. It was getting embarrassing phoning the reception; the girl must think we are such a pair of nuisance. Another five minutes and the tv remote was sent to our room. I rate the reception desk 's service 10/10.

reviews.title: another great stay
reviews.text: At the restaurant although there weren't much choice in their menu I was pleasantly surprised by the speed of service and the quality of the dish I ordered and the drinks was very reasonably priced, much cheaper than most 3 star rated hotel I stayed in the pasts (has there been a mistake? I wonder). The breakfast is excellent; fresh fruit salad bar, different cereals and yoghurt, freshly squeezed orange juice and they serve fresh mushrooms (not the tinned ones other 4 star rated hotel serve) I would rate the restaurant 8/10 only because of the limited choice in their evening menu but the service is once again excellent.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in Fromby
reviews.text: The golf course: For the time of the year (1st week of March) after a bad winter, lots of rain and hard frosts the greens a running very true and lightning fast. The course must have an A1 standard drainage system because it's very dry like in summer condition. Lots of pot bunkers but you should have no problem if you know how to avoid them!! Lots of big lakes dotted around the course which make the game very interesting and challenging. Altogether the course is very immaculate and of excellent standard. One thing I would like to see when I come back next time is a course marshall and a starter like they do in most championship courses. My home course is also a championship course and is longer than Formby. It takes me and a playing partner 3.15 hours the most to finish a round. And here at Formby for the first time in my golfing life a round took us 5.30 hours!!! (4.30 hours the previous day).Totally ridiculous and unacceptable. 4 ball hackers are stupidly oblivious or pretending to be ignorant, just do not want to let through a 2 ball and the rest of the golfers behind (3 groups waiting on the same tee on several tees) obviously got so annoyed and frustrated. This shouldn't happen if there is a marshall sorting out the hopeless, thoughtless and selfish hackers. This complaint is of course nothing to do with the hotel but should be given attention by the golf director if to encourage golfing visitors to return. I thought we will have almost 2 hours spare to rest and have a drink on the 19th but all we both want is to quickly get away. We did stopped at the motorway services on the M6 for the much needed drink and rest.

reviews.title: Lack of attention to detail
reviews.text: I would dearly like to stay in this hotel again and to play their beautiful golf course and I hope they will employ a course marshall.

reviews.title: Fantastic Staff

reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.title: Wonderful!!
reviews.text: Due to the age of our baby we used the room service for our meals, the food was delivered hot and within 15 minutes. We were able to use the restaraunt menu in the evening after I saw the chef in reception who was really helpful.

reviews.title: Great place But !
reviews.text: We also used the pool and leisure facilities which we spot on.

reviews.title: Attention to detail was needed
reviews.text: There was excellent choice at breakfast and again helpful happy staff.

aka: Formby Hall Golf Resort And Spa
description: Set amongst 200 acres of parkland, at the heart of England’s Golf Coast, Formby Hall Golf Resort & Spa offers the definitive 4* golf resort, luxury spa and hotel experience. We have 7 luxury treatment rooms, including 1 triple & 2 doubles, available for massages and treatments such as wraps and facials, manicures and pedicures by Leighton Denny all carried out by our highly trained therapists. The challenging 72-par Old Course boasts an excellent pedigree and is an established venue on the European Challenge Tour, while the 9-hole par three course has been described as the best in the UK. For corporate golf days, visitor golf open days, weekend golf breaks, golf society days, or even a golf lesson at the UK’s first PGA National Residential Golf Academy, Formby Hall is the ideal place to improve your game. So whether you’re a beginner or a seasoned pro, welcome to pure golf heaven. We have a choice of four purpose built air-conditioned rooms to suit any size meeting or conference. All meeting & conference rooms at Formby Hall can be tailor made to suit your exact requirements by our experienced events team. We can also offer support for any secretarial, travel or equipment services you may require.Stunning location, friendly atmosphere - Formby Hall is the ultimate party venue, whatever the occasion. With a choice of chic function suites we can accommodate virtually any size of event. The dance floor and bar provide plenty of room for guests to mingle, while those wanting a quiet moment can step out onto the balcony and enjoy the panoramic views over the golf course and parkland. But it's about much more than just the setting, it's about the service too. Our dedicated event managers will help you plan your special day down to the last detail.
